title: How to Make Apple Crisp in the Microwave

steps.headline: Prepare the apples.
steps.description: Use a vegetable peeler on the apples and slice them, to the thickness you want. The average apple slice amount would come to four cups.

steps.headline: Make the crumble.
steps.description: Combine the butter, Bisquick mix, oats, spices, and brown sugar in a small bowl.

steps.headline: Lay the apple slices in a microwaveable dish.
steps.description: You can either use an 8-inch square one for depth or a 2-quart casserole dish for a thin layered crisp.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the crumble mix over the apples evenly.
Microwave the apple crisp for 5 minutes on high, uncovered.
Rotate the dish halfway and heat for an additional 2-4 minutes.
steps.description: You'll want the apple slices to be tender and soft.

steps.headline: Serve this with berries, ice cream, or other desserts.

text: Prepare the apples. Use a vegetable peeler on the apples and slice them, to the thickness you want. The average apple slice amount would come to four cups. Make the crumble. Combine the butter, Bisquick mix, oats, spices, and brown sugar in a small bowl. Lay the apple slices in a microwaveable dish. You can either use an 8-inch square one for depth or a 2-quart casserole dish for a thin layered crisp. Sprinkle the crumble mix over the apples evenly.  Microwave the apple crisp for 5 minutes on high, uncovered.  Rotate the dish halfway and heat for an additional 2-4 minutes. You'll want the apple slices to be tender and soft. Serve this with berries, ice cream, or other desserts.
